main event: A single unidentified object was observed over Dayton, Ohio on June 9, 1960, for a duration of 15-20 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as pear-shaped and lighter in color than the sky, observed at an estimated altitude of 800-1000 ft., The sighting occurred at night under bright conditions and the object appeared to be steady, It was compared in brightness to a star but was seen to be more prominent, There were no known aircraft or vehicles in the area at the time of the sighting, The case was closed as unidentified by the U.S. Air Force.
witness description: One observer who described the object as a light.
